derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'something inspiring trust; credentials'): from Latin fiduciarius, from fiducia 'trust', from fidere 'to trust'

entry.def: Fiduciary is used to talk about things which relate to a trust, or to the people who are in charge of a trust.

example.ex: They have a case against their directors for breach of fiduciary duty.
example.tran: 他们掌握了足够的证据控告董事违犯信托责任。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who holds assets in trust for a beneficiary;

sentences.sentence: "it is illegal for a fiduciary to misappropriate money for personal gain"

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or of the nature of a legal trust (i.e. the holding of something in trust for another);

stems_affixes.word_buile: confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ent……的→adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 秘[机]密的;表示信任的;担任机密工作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: confident[adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的]+ial……的→相信的人才知道

fid信任,相信,信念+uciary……的→相信的→信托的
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
af一再+fid信任,相信,信念+avit表名词→一再发誓相信→宣誓书
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ant人→confidant可以吐露真情的人
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ence表名词→n.[in]信任;信心,自信;秘密,机密
fid信任,相信,信念+elity表示性质→相信的性质
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
